meanings.definition: Behaving in a way that shows a belief in one's superiority over others.
meanings.sent1: She always acts snobbish around people she thinks are not as good as her.
meanings.sent2: The snobbish lady refused to talk to anyone she deemed unworthy.
meanings.sent3: He put on a snobbish air whenever he wore his expensive suit.
meanings.sent4: Her snobbish attitude was like a high wall separating her from everyone else.
meanings.sent5: The snobbish behavior of the rich man made everyone feel uncomfortable.

meanings.definition: Characteristic of or resembling a snob.
meanings.sent1: The snobbish behavior of the character in the movie was quite amusing.
meanings.sent2: She had a snobbish taste in fashion, always choosing the most expensive brands.
meanings.sent3: The cat's snobbish expression made everyone laugh at the party.
meanings.sent4: The snobbish decor of the restaurant made it feel exclusive and fancy.
meanings.sent5: His snobbish manners made him stand out in the crowd.

meanings.definition: Showing disapproval or contempt towards others perceived as inferior.
meanings.sent1: Her snobbish remarks about their neighborhood were hurtful.
meanings.sent2: He gave a snobbish look to the student who couldn't answer the question.
meanings.sent3: The snobbish tone in her voice made everyone uncomfortable.
meanings.sent4: The snobbish glare she gave him made him feel small.
meanings.sent5: The snobbish attitude of the teacher towards struggling students was disappointing.
